Fields.DialogueText: *KABOOM*
We're under fire! To your positions!
Don't worry, Captain. I've got your back!
@BATTLE
Good work out there, Argus. What would I do without you?
Die a slow and painful death, most likely.
... Regardless, you did well out there, Hatbox.
... Captain... Where did you hear that name?
Hm? I heard some of the men referring to you by it. I assumed it was some kind of nickname.
... Is that so...?

Fields.MenuText: Was I mistaken?
What does it mean?
Why has your face gone purple...?

Fields.DialogueText: No, Captain. That is definitely one of my "nicknames," all right.
I'm surprised at you, Captain. You would do well to research things before you go spouting them willy-nilly.
Oh, this? Must be yesterday's meal repeating on me.
But you skipped dinner yesterday...
Is this a name you aren't particularly fond of?
The name "Hatbox" refers to my... *ahem* top-heaviness, shall we say.
Argus, you must believe me, I had no--
It's fine, Captain! I don't expect people to NOT make fun of my proportions! They are, after all, so obviously hilarious!
I've received word of our next mission. Perhaps we could discuss over a cup of tea and an apology.
Delightful! You must give me a moment, Captain. There appear to be a few stray Morganas on the horizon. Don't send the men, I'll handle these lot on my own.
*Ahem* As you will.
Look! That one Morgana looks just like you, don't you think?
I can't really make it out from--
No, no, it's a spitting image! Anyway, must dash. I have to go and destroy it!
As a ship.
You wanted to see me, Captain?
Ah, yes. We've received word of our next assignment. We're to transport several damaged scout planes for repair.
Wonderful! Obviously, any damage sustained to an aircraft is cause for concern, but I love seeing new planes!
Here are a list of the planes and the pilots for full clarity.
I'll do my best!

Fields.MenuText: Any names strike your fancy?

Fields.DialogueText: I'll have a proper look later, Captain! This is like Christmas Eve - we can't go opening the presents early!

Fields.MenuText: Perhaps, if you know any of these men, you can give them a stern talking to for damaging their aircrafts.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm sure none of the pilots were at fault. Instead of a scolding, I'll give my best advice.

Fields.MenuText: Try to hide that grin of yours should any of these pilots be missing limbs...

Fields.DialogueText: Of course, Captain. I'll be the epitome of professionalism and smile about their potentially life-threatening injuries in private.
*ALARM*
That's all for now. Once you take care of the Morganas, you're dismissed.
Thank you, Captain!
@BATTLE
I see you're keeping busy, Argus. What are you up to?
Oh, Captain! I'm compiling a list of interview questions for any pilots we might come across.
Whatever for?
I may seek to recruit them into my pilot training regimen. I need to know if they have the right stuff!

Fields.MenuText: What kind of specs are you looking for?

Fields.DialogueText: Brains, common sense, overall skill... you know, the works! My institute will be the best of the best and I can't risk enrolling any slackers!

Fields.MenuText: Surely if they meet your expectations, they have nothing left to learn.

Fields.DialogueText: Right you are! Those who scrape by can take remedial lessons, while those without fault can be interim teachers!

Fields.MenuText: What kind of questions are you asking?

Fields.DialogueText: Mental aptitude tests such as "how do you handle pressure," but also general knowledge about planes as a whole.
*ALARM*
Save it for later, Argus. We've got company!
Yes, Captain!
@BATTLE
Just a little longer now and all the damaged planes should be loaded onto the ship.
And... that should do it. All loaded on.
Look, Captain! I caught a glance at one of them! Let's go and take a look!
You really love planes, huh?
More than ships, even. At least, that's what the other Belles say.
You really do have your eyes in the sky.
In more ways than one! Some people say I was the first real aircraft carrier - I have to take that seriously.
*ALARM*
Come on, let's handle the Morganas and then take a gander!
@BATTLE
Captain! Look at the shine on this one's paintwork!
It certainly is--
And the craftsmanship on this one is superb! Even though it's been damaged, you can tell the builder's heart and soul went into designing it.

Fields.MenuText: What spawned your desire to build a flight school?

Fields.DialogueText: A love of planes mostly. That and the desire to help those struggling to find their wings.

Fields.MenuText: I didn't realize you were so passionate.

Fields.DialogueText: How can I not be? Just look at these masterpieces!

Fields.MenuText: I think you'd prefer a museum as opposed to a flight school under your command.

Fields.DialogueText: A museum would be nice, but I'd rather attend one myself rather than be in charge of one. Let alone become one.
*ALARM*
Morganas! Let's move!
Aye aye!
@BATTLE
No rest for the wicked, I see.
Captain, care to join me? I'm working on some of the plans for the flight school once it's full up and running.
Mind if I take a look?
Please do. I think I'm overthinking this. The more you know about something...
The less you think you know.
Right you are.

Fields.MenuText: There's a first time for everything.

Fields.DialogueText: You would think so. But even still, I would like to think I would have seen that first time coming.

Fields.MenuText: Another blind spot, perhaps?

Fields.DialogueText: Or the same blind spot manifesting anew.

Fields.MenuText: You don't have to feel bad about it.

Fields.DialogueText: No, no, I'm fine. It's more disbelief than depression. Disbelief... with a sprinkle of intrigue.
Captain, how would you feel about becoming my business partner?
Argus, you've forgotten more about air doctrine than I'll ever learn.
Still, you managed to poke a hole in what I thought was a bulletproof plan. Having someone else proofread even what looks like a masterpiece can be invaluable.
*ALARM*
Well, if you would have me, I would love to come aboard.
Great! First order of business: help me deal with these Morganas so we can get back to it!
@BATTLE
Hmm. Do you have a system of evaluation in place? For the pilots? I mean, it's great to think they'll just learn what you're teaching, but...
... And here I was fretting over fuel requisitions.
The first step, Captain, will be to get you up to speed with my plans so far for the flight school.
Proceed.
Well, I'll skip all the intricacies and get straight to the point. I want the best, and I will have it. Any nationality, any race, any preferred flavor of ice cream! Nothing matters other than skill.

Fields.MenuText: I respect that very much.

Fields.DialogueText: Aces can come from anywhere. I was meant to be Italian, remember - before the last war.

Fields.MenuText: Even mint?

Fields.DialogueText: Unfortunately, yes. Perhaps we'll be extra tough on those applicants to try and drive them out.

Fields.MenuText: How forceful.

Fields.DialogueText: I know what I want when it comes to this dream, Captain. As you can probably tell, it is very important to me.
*ALARM*
Here, I've drawn up a list of notes to help you get started. Once you read through those, let me know.
Will do, ma'am.
You don't need to stand at attention for me, Captain. Not yet.
@BATTLE
Captain, do you have a minute? How goes the reading?
I'm steadily making my way through it. Do you need something?
This is the list of names you gave me before. Of the pilots we'll be meeting.
Yes?
I finally got around to looking at it. Skip to page four in my document. Notice anything?
One name here appears in both. Ace Windrunner. That can't be his real name…
Ace is an ace pilot and the most-scouted veteran by aircraft carriers such as myself looking to make a pilot school.
… His name is literally "Ace." Isn't that a bit on the nose?
No time, Captain! We have to have him for our program!

Fields.MenuText: How "ace" can he be if he totaled his plane?

Fields.DialogueText: I looked it up. He totaled that plane rescuing one of his team by performing an incredibly unsafe manoeuvre.

Fields.MenuText: … I need to see this man's birth certificate.

Fields.DialogueText: Get over the name, Captain!

Fields.MenuText: How do we go about recruiting him?

Fields.DialogueText: That's the difficult part.
The only problem is, Ace is notorious for flying solo. He hates teamwork and everything about it. We'll have to convince him otherwise.
*ALARM*
Before anything, let's handle the Morganas.
@BATTLE
It worked out, but his plane paid the price.
The second plane has been delivered, Captain. I asked the foreman about Ace and was told he'll be here soon to check on it.
I already don't like this guy. Reckless, unfeeling, loner.
Remind you of anyone?

Fields.MenuText: What should we do when he arrives?

Fields.DialogueText: Just leave the talking to me, Captain. Just stick to the side and look pretty.

Fields.MenuText: I feel like you're insulting at least one of us there, and in neither case does it seem fair.
... "WINDRUNNER?!"

Fields.DialogueText: If you can't settle yourself, I'll send you back onto the ship!
There look to be a few Morganas on approach. We'll handle them and then return.
Yes, Captain.
@BATTLE
It's a legitimate concern, and I regret nothing.
Here he comes, Captain. Play it cool.
Please.
You must be Argus!
That's right.
Splendid to meet you, young lady! Name's Ace, but feel free to call me Windy!
Nice to meet you, Ace. This is my captain.
Jolly good! You must run a fine ship to have tamed such a deadly maiden as Argus. All I can say is thanks!
... It's no problem at all, Ace!
Oho, Captain, wasn't there something you wanted to say to Ace?

Fields.MenuText: Don't be silly, Argus! Ace is clearly a stand-up guy!
Ssh!
I just wanted to ask... how you get your hair like that...?

Fields.DialogueText: Ha! Flatter me too much and you can roast a pig on my cheeks! The pleasure's all mine, old sport!
Never letting that go.
Three parts hair gel, two parts engine fluid! It sounds crazy, but so does an invasion of otherworldly monster ships, am I right?
Hmph!
Oh, look - Morganas! We'd better cut this short.
Allow me to lend a hand, little darling. It's the least I can do for returning my baby to shore.
... Gosh.
@BATTLE
You want me to what now?
We'd love for you to join our pilot training program as an instructor.
While I'm flattered, I don't think I--
We know how you feel about teamwork. However, your plane won't be fit to fly for a while. How about you join us at sea for a spell and see if we'd make a good match?
Well...

Fields.MenuText: Come on, Ace! It'll be fun!
You owe us.

Fields.DialogueText: That I do! And a real man always pays his debts!
Well, if such an esteemed captain wants me aboard, how can I refuse?

Fields.MenuText: Fine, don't come.

Fields.DialogueText: Old Ace is wise to a little reverse psychology. There's no need - I'm in!
Great! Your first test begins... now!
Jolly good!
@BATTLE
So, Ace, we'd love to hear about your travels.
Not much to tell, to be honest.
Surely you didn't get such a reputation from nowhere.
Oh, I've been around the block a few times. I once hung onto the side of an aircraft for fifty miles while tracking an enemy. I performed a triple loop through a fjord while evading a Morgana.
Incredible!
But none of it is as important as coming home alive. My reckless abandon should not be imitated. That's why I don't think I'm a good fit for your school.
I see...
Besides, looking out for people is more trouble than it's worth. Looking out for my team is what got my plane totaled in the first place.

Fields.MenuText: What happened?

Fields.DialogueText: One of my crew was spiraling. I had to knock him out of his collision course with a mountain and into the sea. My wing got clipped, and here we are.

Fields.MenuText: Were you hurt?

Fields.DialogueText: It'll take more than a obstructive mountain and a bounty from God to take down Old Windy!

Fields.MenuText: How fascinating.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm sure you and the young lady have been through countless adventures as well, no doubt!
If you are so opposed to teamwork, why were you in a team in the first place? And why did you choose to save that man?
The team were all but forced upon me for this particular mission. As to why I saved him... Call it a lapse of judgement. It won't happen again.
*ALARM*
Allow us to save *you* this time.
Let's go, Captain!
@BATTLE
Ace seems to be fitting in rather nicely, don't you think?
He certainly is a character.
Still. I need to know what he likes so we can tailor our recruitment technique to his liking.

Fields.MenuText: We could probe him more.

Fields.DialogueText: Everything he says is so vague. It's like he's talking in catchphrases.

Fields.MenuText: How do you propose we do that?

Fields.DialogueText: I may have a plan.

Fields.MenuText: He is a tricky nut to crack.

Fields.DialogueText: The best ones always are!
It's a shame, but we'll have to spy on him.
What's with that face?
I think you might have a small problem with voyeuris--
*ALARM*
Hm? What was that, Captain? The alarm was drowning out whatever incorrect statement you were about to make. Let's get to work!
@BATTLE
There he goes, Captain. Quickly now!

Fields.MenuText: I can't believe you talked me into this.

Fields.DialogueText: We had no other choice!

Fields.MenuText: We've been following him for hours now.

Fields.DialogueText: No rest for the wicked!

Fields.MenuText: What are you hoping to uncover?

Fields.DialogueText: Anything at all at this point!
He's going back inside with a... towel?
He's going to have a shower. Hurry, this is our chance!
Argus!
Hm?
Do you have no boundaries?!
Oh, right...
You don't spy on anyone else in the shower, do you?
... Look, Captain! He left his jacket on the deck!
There's a picture in the pocket of Ace with someone.
Flip it over.
"Dearest Ace, good luck soaring to the skies - Nate." They look pretty similar. Maybe they're brothers.
*ALARM*
That's a sign we should be getting out of here! Come on!
@BATTLE
What do you think that picture was all about?
They were likely brothers. As you said.
Were?
Do you often carried damaged photos of your still living loved ones?
I wonder what happened...

Fields.MenuText: We can't ask.

Fields.DialogueText: Right, he'll know we were spying then.

Fields.MenuText: It isn't our place to say anything.

Fields.DialogueText: The last thing I want to do is offend him.

Fields.MenuText: You'd better stop wondering.

Fields.DialogueText: Some things in life I am not meant to see. I'm still working on that.
*ALARM*
Let's sit on it for a while. I'm sure the right path will present itself.
@BATTLE
Thanks for inviting me out with you guys!
No problem at all.
Oh, Captain, look - a dress vendor!
I'm sure we have enough in the budget for one.
Only one?! Hmm, which one should I pick...

Fields.MenuText: How about this one? It's covered in peacock eyes.

Fields.DialogueText: Good eye! Captain! I would have missed it without your help!
You guys make a great team.
Let's head back to the ship. I'm sure I saw some Morganas circling.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: How about this? Simple, good for warm days - perfect for Arcadian shepherds and their minders!
I dunno. That one's cheap.

Fields.DialogueText: ... Really? That's what you're going for?
Captain! I'm ready for our sparring session!
Let me see what you've got!
What's all this?
Oh, Ace! Feel free to sit in. I'm just practicing with my blade. Here I come!
*CLASH* *WHIPCRACK*
How's my form?

Fields.MenuText: Raise your shoulder a little. It'll help your balance.

Fields.DialogueText: Are you calling me top-heavy again?

Fields.MenuText: Bend your knees more. It will help offset the--
Lift your head up. It's drooping toward the--

Fields.DialogueText: Other than that, you're looking great!
Thanks a lot, Captain. It's nice to be able to rely on you for these kinds of things.
*ALARM*
Morganas! Let's show off that sword skill a little more!
Aye aye!
@BATTLE
How unsanitary...
Just a little further now.
Something the matter? Who is this slovenly fellow?
The men got a little too rambunctious last night. This is the result of a keg full of rum.
I despise inebriation. Look at this man! He couldn't defend himself if I slowly sawed off his arm with a butter knife.

Fields.MenuText: You've never been drunk?

Fields.DialogueText: I can't risk lowering my mental capacity even by an inch. I may miss something vital.

Fields.MenuText: Please don't do that... ever.

Fields.DialogueText: If you insist.

Fields.MenuText: He's pretty heavy.

Fields.DialogueText: His body weight is 50% rum at this point.
Come on, we're nearly at his quarters. You lift the front and I'll lift the back.
Aye aye...
You folks need a hand?
Oh, please don't trouble yourself, Ace. This kind of thing is no match for the Captain and I.
*ALARM*
We'll drop this oaf off and deal with the Morganas!
Yes, Captain!
@BATTLE
I've figured out how we can confront Ace about his possible brother.
Lay it on me.
Take another look at this photo. His brother's wearing a shark tooth necklace. While we're docked, let's buy one and leave it outside his door.

Fields.MenuText: Really?

Fields.DialogueText: Trust me.
I'll send someone out to shop and then you and I can head back to the ship. There are likely some Morganas that we'll need to deal with!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Or we could just get an entire shark.
... Okay, on the grand list of crazy Belle plans, that's not even top ten. I'm almost disappointed.

Fields.DialogueText: Okay, how did you do it?
Whatever do you mean, Ace?
I don't know how you know about him or what he used to wear, but it's bothering me and I need to know.
Oh, your brother named Nate? And his shark tooth necklace? Call it intuition.
... Captain, am I going crazy?

Fields.MenuText: That's just Argus. She sees everything.

Fields.DialogueText: Past, present, and future!

Fields.MenuText: I felt the same way my first time too.

Fields.DialogueText: Captain! Don't make me sound like such a pest!

Fields.MenuText: You're not crazy. Argus on the other-- OW!

Fields.DialogueText: Sorry, Captain! My fist slipped.
*ALARM*
Very well. Once you return from your battle, I'll spill my beans. Take care.
@BATTLE
My brother died in action. We were in the midst of a heated battle and there were some bogeys on my tail. He gave his life to save me.
How dreadful.

Fields.MenuText: We're sorry for your loss.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't be! It happened years ago! If I start weeping, he'll never let me hear the end of it in the afterlife!

Fields.MenuText: What happened exactly?

Fields.DialogueText: We were out of ammunition. The only way for him to stop them from sniping me out of the sky was to crash his plane into theirs. They both fell into the ocean.

Fields.MenuText: We didn't mean to pry.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not sure who has the biggest nose - Nosey Nelly over there or Captain Pinocchio!
Either way, I don't like to talk about it too much.
You loved him very much.
Ha! He was a fool! That man died for nothing...
*ALARM*
You wait right there... There are some things I need to say to you, Ace.
@BATTLE
How can you say your brother died for nothing?
Because it's true.
He died saving someone precious to him. War is hell, and we can't always plan everything accordingly. All we can do is look out for those we care about and hope they do the same for us.

Fields.MenuText: Couldn't have put it better myself.
You've certainly changed.

Fields.DialogueText: I learnt from the best.
It's how I truly feel now.

Fields.MenuText: And I always will.

Fields.DialogueText: I know you will, Captain.
*ALARM*
I need to lie down. We'll arrive tomorrow. Please leave me until then.
Of course. Argus, with me.
@BATTLE
Here we are.
It's been nice traveling with you, Ace. Your plane is ready to go.
Folks, it has been an honor in your company. Argus, I would love to come aboard your program once all the kinks are settled out.
Great news!

Fields.MenuText: What made you change your mind?
Even though she spies on you in the sho- OW!

Fields.DialogueText: Tread carefully, Captain.
I've heard the words a thousand times, but...

Fields.MenuText: You'll have to sign some paperwork. Plus we'll need a legal copy of your birth--

Fields.DialogueText: We can sort that all out later, Captain! Much later...
What really sealed the deal was seeing how well you two complement each other. Carrying drunkards, choosing dresses, sparring... I miss having someone to look out for.
And someone who can look out for you.
*ALARM*
Go on now. I'll be in contact soon. Don't you worry about old Ace.
... I still think "Windrunner" is a crock.
@BATTLE
... Nice guy.
Oh, go on. I know you've been waiting to say it.
I haven't.
You have. Go on.
Feel better?
Much.
What are you up to, Argus?
Just drawing up a contract for Ace whenever he decides to join.

Fields.MenuText: You certainly work fast.

Fields.DialogueText: The sooner he signs this contract, the less time he has to change his mind!

Fields.MenuText: I think he'll make a great addition.

Fields.DialogueText: As do I. Although we'll have to work on the cockiness.

Fields.MenuText: He won't be joining for some time, right?

Fields.DialogueText: Still, I'd like to get it sorted for whenever he's ready.
What do you think about everything Ace said? There's a lot of him in you, I think.
Actually, Captain. I've been meaning to tell you...
*ALARM*
Say we handle the Morganas and retire to your quarters.
As you wish.
@BATTLE
You get settled in here, Captain. I'll be right back after finishing up with the Morganas!
Be careful out there.
@BATTLE
About Ace's speech... I think we were both heading down a very different road without your influence.

Fields.MenuText: I didn't do much.

Fields.DialogueText: Without even knowing, you managed to help us both.

Fields.MenuText: It may not be such a bad road.

Fields.DialogueText: Perhaps not... but a very lonely one, no doubt.

Fields.MenuText: Like I said, you seem a lot like him.

Fields.DialogueText: "Seemed," Captain. "Seemed."
What are you trying to say, Argus?
Nate and Ace are family. While we can never be that close, I can't help but feel like our relationship is advancing past that of a formal captain and crewmate.
How so?
When I think of losing you, I think of losing a dear friend. I would hope you would consider me the same way when watching my blind spot.
A friend, huh? I see no problem with that.
Wonderful! Shall I make us some tea?
Actually, I think may take a shower first.
Heh. Be my guest.
